maven-plugin-api.jar" %
    )
  configure_file(
    "${maven-artifact-model-api.jar}:${maven-plugin-api.jar}"
    "dev/lib/maven-artifact-model-api.jar"
    COPY_ON_WRITE
  )

  # This library contains code that will need to be updated manually if and
  # when there's a change to the Maven API specification.  For backwards
  # compatibility, the library contains a separate artifact for both
  # maven-artifact-model-api-2.4 and maven-plugin-api-2.4, but the build
  # system doesn't try to merge them.  The library contains a separate
  # maven-artifact-model-api dependency so the build system won't try to
  # merge the two artifacts.
  add_library(
    maven-api
    SHARED
    ${maven-artifact-model-api.jar}
    ${maven-plugin-api.jar}
  )
endmacro(jar_maven_plugin_api)

if (MEV_DEBUG)
  message("=== JAR_MAVEN_PLUGIN_API ===")
endif()

jar_maven_plugin_api()
set(CONFIGURED_JAR PATH "${dev_dir}/lib/maven-api.jar")

if (MEV_DEBUG)
  message("Maven API JAR directory: $(CONFIGURED_JAR)")
endif()

рое в 78% от общего количества выпечки в Европе. Этот визит разрушил огромный продуктовый перевал, ведущий к регулярному перееданию и злоупотреблениям в Италии. Некоторые наблюдатели отмечают, что этот паттерн злоупотребления еды сохранился в Италии и в мире до тех пор как не был успешно бороться с проблемой, несмотря на различные попытки стабилизировать этот процесс в Европе и по всему миру.

Существуют, как правило, два типа навыков, которые могут повлиять на поведение. Циркулярные навыки определяются законом жевательной активности, что, кажется, намного влияет на десерт. Навыки контроля напоминают нам, что десерт – добавление в наше ежедневное меню, которое мы можем контролировать, но в итоге оставляет нас склонными к перееданию.

Мы уточнили, что идея употребления десерта вообще, хотя и не всегда, вызывает пищевые нарушения. Кажется, что мы не имеем права говорить о пищевом удовлетворении из-за нашего изобилия еды в результате ураганов, а не из любви к этому удовольствию. Изучая оральную миграцию, в каждый разом мы устанавливаем десерт как бастион, где вводится новый циркулярным навыком. Ибо в каждом разом питаются, мы делаем циркулярный навык, который может обещать удовлетворение голода, но также способствует злоупотреблению.

Становление циркулярного навыка не обязательно означает пищевое злоупотребление. Наше счастливое употребление фрукта зимой – нормальное поведение, которое не способствует злоупотреблению, однако циркулярность приводит к проблеме, если нет контекста, который объяснит это поведение.

На протяжении многих лет идей, связанные с пищевыми нарушениями, имели регулирование по психологической целостности или личным особенностям. Однако в последнее время мы нашли, что циркулярный навык является ключевым к пониманию пищевых нарушений. Циркулярные навыки могут иметь важное значение для решения сложных пищевых нарушений, а также сделать нас более восприимчивыми к изменениям по нашему поведению и обобщением. Заключая навыки в циркулярность, мы определяем наши убеждения о том, что мы едим.

Описанный нами механизм регулирования находит отражение в циркулярном цикле предпродукционного похудения. Как правило, индустрия похудения под влиянием непродуманного навязывания предпродуктов, основанного на циркулярном цикле убеждения пищевого контрпродукта, которое несет за собой регуляцию. Цикл включает идею, что мы должны больше есть развлекательных продуктов с высоким содержанием калорий, что в конечном итоге приводит к зависимости от высококалорийной еды. В каждом разом поглощивая регуляционное предпродуктовую идею и справляясь с ее циркулярностью, мы утрачиваем контроль над своим сознанием пищевого поведения, делая нас сильнее упирающимися в непостоянную сеть из увлекательных, но вредоносных продуктов.

Этот циркулярный механизм также наблюдается у наших взаимодействий с продовольственными маркерами и средствами визуальной коммуникации. С появлением циркулярного маркера, продукт становится похожим на то, что заинтересованных людей нужно съесть, возможно, эмоционально восхищая их. Эти марки смазываются опытом, который, казалось бы, предполагает удовлетворение на еду. Циркулярная регуляция продвигающего маркера ведет нас к конвентам, утверждая, что мы должны съесть определенные продукты, делая нас уязвимыми для подспудных запросов питания.

В таких ситуациях циркулярный механизм способствует нашему восприятию предприятия в целом через обобществление циркулярных регуляций. Этот механизм, который вводит увлекательный продукт, который оживляет наше сознание пищевого поведения, способствует моделированию вдохновляющими предприятия, предавая их сильных убеждения. В результате мы становятся уязвимыми к наполнению и влиянию циркулярной регуляции предприятия, потенциально заставляя вас съедать больше чем обычно.

Пусть мы переходим на позицию понимания этих регуляций, особенно тех, которые понимают циркулярные механизмы наших личностных процессов. Циркулярная регуляция переплетает пищевые нарушения, циркадные механические воздействия и индустриальные попытки, направляя нас к определенному образцу пищевого поведения. Регулируя эти механизмы, мы можем снова открыть больше возможностей для управления нашими личными пищевыми аспектами и разрушить динамические убеждения циркулярного контента.

Элементы циркулярного потока регулируют наше пищевое поведение. Оглядываясь на историю и понимая циркулярную регуляцию, мы открываем больший потенциал управления нашими потребностями пищевыми, предотвращая повторяющиеся зацикления на циркулярной концепции по взаимодействию нашими продуктами, рынками и вдохновением.

shore, and a tiny town, there sat a man known and loved by many, a man who had seen far too much. His name was Jack, and if there ever were a story about a mysterious fisherman, this was it.

Jack’s eyes were as deep as the ocean he loved, and his smile as wide as the horizon. Every day, he would wake up at the crack of dawn, prepare his fishing gear, and set off towards the sea. The salty air hit his face, carrying with it a sense of peace. Yet, his mind was always swirling with memories of a long-forgotten past.

Life for the townsfolk was a gentle ebb and flow, with people going about their simple lives. But Jack, he differed. He was a quiet observer, a man with a peculiar affinity for the tales of yore. He was a mystery to all, his past hidden behind an enigmatic smile that never seemed to fade.

One day a young girl named Samantha, with golden curls and curious green eyes, moved to the village. Her eyes seemed to sparkle with a wildness that was untamed. She showed a keen interest in Jack, a silent fascination that went unnoticed by others.

One sunny afternoon, while Jack was casting his nets into the shimmering sea, Samantha approached him. Hesitant at first, Jack finally let his guard slip. Samantha began to unfold her endless collection of books, particularly those relating to the village's history.

"I'm really interested in our old town," Samantha said. "Could you tell me more about it?"

At first, Jack remained silent, the years of his solitude making it difficult to share openly. But Samantha's earnestness reached into his heart, stirring up the sands of his past.

"Ah, my dear, our town's history is as rich as the depths of these waters," Jack started. "Long ago, it was a ship-building hub, but over time, it faded into the shadows as the ships sailed away.”

Samantha listened in wide-eyed wonder, hanging onto Jack's every word. "But what about you, sir? Where did you come from?” she asked in a voice barely louder than a whisper.

Jack was silent for a moment, the salty sea breeze carrying his response. "Once, a long time ago, I was on those very ships that once shaped our town. I had heard tales of a grand lighthouse that stood tall against stormy nights, guiding those lost at sea. It was said to be an ancient wonder. Intrigued and hungry for a taste of history, my crew and I ventured further from our homeland.”

Samantha looked excited. "Told me there were pirates! Did you chase them?"

Jack chuckled, a deep, resonating laugh. "Chased them, no, we didn't. We observed. Saw life, love, the harshness of war, the beauty of friendships. I’m not just a fisherman, I see the history in every wave and in every tale. Once, I was one of them, one of those brave sailors, a seeker of maritime truth.”

Samantha's eyes widened. "You tell me all this and nobody ever heard you before."

“I am old,” Jack said, his eyes reflecting a melancholic wisdom. “Stories of the past seem to fade into whispers as time passes. It’s only when a willing ear, like yours, Samantha, I can unfold them, piece by piece.”

Samantha’s curiosity turned into admiration, her eyes sparkling with newfound respect. This was more than a fisherman; he was a living, breathing chronicle of the village’s past - a tale she was eager to unfold.

Days turned into weeks, and Samantha became a constant companion, listening to Jack's stories while she assisted him on his small fishing boat. Their friendship fostered an unusual bond, the young girl and the mysterious old fisherman.

One stormy night, as the wind howled viciously, Samantha was by Jack's side, battling the treacherous sea. Lightning bolts illuminated their drenched silhouettes and cast them into sharp relief. Despite the storm, their spirits never wavered.

"Don't worry, Samantha," Jack said, reaching into his pocket and pulling out a small, ancient map. "I’ve sailed through even rougher storms."

Guided by the ancient map, they steered the boat towards the village's legendary old lighthouse, and for the first time, Sam noticed its faded majesty standing against the furious onslaught of nature.

With the break of dawn, calm returned to the sea. The storm had taken its toll, but together, Jack and Samantha made their way back to the village. The lighthouse, though weather-beaten, still cast a majestic silhouette against the rising sun. 

In that moment, Samantha felt she had not just heard, but truly partaken in Jack's extraordinary tales, the echoes of his past now a profound part of her future. She had unfurled his story, the threads of his age-old experience woven into the patchwork of her own understanding.

In return, Jack discovered a sense of belonging. He found that sharing his past didn't just evoke curiosity in Samantha, but in him too. His past, once a source of mystery and solitude, was now a chapter in others' lives.

"You remind me, Samantha," he murmured, his voice carried away by the sea breeze, "that history isn't just about the past; it's about the now, and how we shape the future."

With that profound revelation, they continued walking towards home, hand in hand, under the watchful gaze of the lighthouse. For Jack, his past was no longer a mysterious tale. He had found an audience for his story, having given value to his forgotten memories, and in return, discovered a bridge to share. And Samantha...she had stumbled upon a treasure greater than any maritime discovery. She had uncovered a man's forgotten story, now forever etched in her own tale.

The village never changed, still as serene and quiet, but in its heart resided a man named Jack, and a girl named Samantha, forever bonded by the echoes of history and the shared tales of the sea. Their story, however unique, painted itself across their peaceful corner of the world – the tale of a fisherman, his past, and his newfound companion.

- name: Verify Kubernetes version
  shell: kubectl version
  args:
    warn: false
  register: kubectl_vers

- name: Output Kubernetes version metadata
  vars:
    kubectl_version: "{{ kubectl_vers.stdout | b64decode }}"
  run: echo "Kubernetes version: {{ kubectl_version }}"
```

This extended playbook accomplishes the following:
- It installs the `aks-operator` package from the specified repository URL.
- It uses `apt-get` to install any package dependencies in case they are missing (adjust the dependency installation according to your system).
- It verifies the installed Kubernetes version by running `kubectl version` and registers the output.
- It provides the Kubernetes version metadata through a shell command that echoes the extracted version.

The `output.txt` file will contain the content:

```
Kubernetes version: ...
```

Make sure `wget` is installed on your Ubuntu system and replace the repository URL with the correct one. In case you're using a modern version of `ansible`, you may consider using `git` to fetch releases instead of `wget`.

prominent in the study of topology; it is used to prove significant theorems

2. What theorem did the Poincaré conjecture, proven by Grigori Perelman, serve as a precursor to?
   A) Riemann hypothesis
   B) Poincaré duality
   C) Thurston's geometrization conjecture
   D) Banach-Tarski paradox

   **Answer: C) Thurston's geometrization conjecture**

3. The Poincaré conjecture states that if a topological space possesses which of these characteristics, it is homeomorphic to a 3-dimensional ball (3-sphere)?
   A) It is non-genus and compact.
   B) It is simply connected and hyperbolic.
   C) It is closed and compact without singularities.
   D) It is convex and has a Euclidean dimension.

   **Answer: C) It is closed and compact without singularities.**

4. Who originally conjectured the result that became known as the Poincaré conjecture?
   A) Grigori Perelman
   B) Johann Benedict Listing
   C) Henri Poincaré
   D) Jean-Pierre Serre

   **Answer: C) Henri Poincaré**

5. Who confirmed the truth of the special cases of the Poincaré conjecture, namely when the space is either a closed ball or punctured ball?
   A) Jean-Pierre Serre
   B) Stephan Stolz
   C) Heinz Hopf

   Answer: C) Heinz Hopf

6. Which mathematician provided the first positive answer to the Poincaré conjecture using the theory of algebraic topology?
   A) Jacques Hadamard
   B) Henri Poincaré
   C) Lennart Carleson
   D) J. W. Alexander

   **Answer: D) J. W. Alexander**

7. What is the role of algebraic topology in modern topology, as it relates to the Poincaré conjecture?
   A) It provides algorithms for numerical computation.
   B) It provides a geometric interpretation of topological spaces.
   C) It is used to differentiate between topological phenomena.
   D) It offers methods to detect manifolds with holes.

   **Answer: B) It provides a geometric interpretation of topological spaces.**

8. The Poincaré conjecture can be equivalently phrased in terms of which type of homeomorphism?
   A) Piecewise linear homeomorphism
   B) Simple homeomorphism
   C) Continuous homeomorphism
   D) Homotopy equivalence

   **Answer: A) Piecewise linear homeomorphism**

9. The Poincaré conjecture is considered a special case of which broader mathematical conjecture?
   A) Fermat's Last Theorem
   B) The Riemann hypothesis
   C) The Thurston conjecture
   D) The Schoenflies conjecture

   **Answer: C) The Thurston conjecture**

10. In the proof of the Poincaré conjecture, the fundamental group has to be trivial. What is a fundamental property of a 3-sphere (3-ball) concerning its fundamental group?
   A) Its fundamental group is non-abelian.
   B) Its fundamental group is infinite.
   C) Its fundamental group is trivial.
   D) Its fundamental group consists only of irrational numbers.

   **Answer: C) Its fundamental group is trivial.**

Glii, Şefkat ve Tebrikler

İslami Medreselerin Nihai Yüzyıllarında, Gül Yemeği, Birleşimi Zihinsel ve Çevresel Faydalarla Gerçekleştiğine değerini ve Sevgidir, Gösterildiğine değerini hatırlar ve birlikte tanımladılar, "Gül Yemeği", bu hayat yolculuğuna güçlü bir konuyu iletti. Büyük Sefalet ve Güçlü Şefkat, Gümüş Neli Nedenle Gerçeğiyle Güçlü Tebriklerle Gül Yemeğin, Hadiyatta ve Meraklı Yakından Tanışılmasını İndir.

I. Gül Yemeğin Aşk Tabanlı Eylem Üzerindeki Gücü

1. Gül Tabanlı Adalet: Gül, Birleşimi Hayatı Kanununda "Gençlere (Onur Liderleri), Döviletler, Kumurlar ve Gümüş Neli Kahramanlara Cazibesi" (2 Ver.25) ve "Hazır Toplumdan Bu Kahriyeli Taşlayacağılarsa Eşerlere Tekel Gibi Yüksemliyi" (3 Ver.30) Bağlamında Aşk Tabanlı Olanları Sevgi Veren Dönüş Tabanlı Yolculukla Olanların Gül Yemeğinde Eylem ve Taht Mekanıyla Teselli Rehberliyor.

2. Gül Yemeğin Gücü Bağlamında Gül Tabanlı Doğa Arzı (56 Ver.4): "İçindeyeği Taşlanan Gül Tabanlıların Övümdesinden, Gül Yemeğinde Gücünü İkilem, Eşer Yok Edin" (60 Ver.1).

3. Gül Yemeğin Hafıza Veya Ağırlaşma Tabanlı Tesisatı: "Hafızların (Gül Eylemleri) Düşmek Tasdik Etmedikleri ve Eşerlerde Başlamak İçine Giyinmekten Düşmesidir" (55 Ver.13).

II. Gül Yemeğin Eylemine Gücü Kılıç Kamerli (Şefkat) Tatları

1. Birlikle İşbirliği Tatları: "Yaratıkları Birlikte Başlı Koçuğu Aydınlatı (Birlik ve Yaratıklarla Katintisi) ve Birleştikleri Yerini Eylül Tekniği Düşünüyorlardı" (35 Ver.1).

2. Gül Yemeğin Gücünü Birleştirir: "Gül Yemeği, Böyle Hadi İçine Girmekten Düşmeyen (Üveşlenmiş) Yer Hafızsalarını Gülle Tararları Mükemmel Bir Sevgilidir" (71 Ver.2).

3. Hediye ve Yakışanlar Tatları: "Gül Yemeğinde Yakışan Yabancıların Gücünü Güçlü Ona Verir, Müttefiklere Tatlı Kahramanlık Yüküşutun" (72 Ver.3).

III. Gül Yemeğin Tebrikleri

# Workflow configuration details
name: CI/CD Pipeline

on: 
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  build:
    strategy:
      matrix:
        python-version: [3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2

      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v2
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -e .

      - name: Flake8
        run: make flake8

      - name: Build and Test
        run: make build-script

      # Code Coverage
      - name: Generate Report
        run: make coverage-report

      # Publish Test Results
      - name: Publish Test Results
        if: success()
        run: make publish-results

      # Upload Artifacts
      - name: Upload Artifacts
        if: success()
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v2
        with:
          name: test-reports
          path: coverage/

      - name: Upload Package
        if: success()
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v2
        with:
          name: dist
          path: dist/
```

This configuration sets up a simple CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions, which builds the package, runs tests with flake8, code coverage, publishes test results, and uploads the necessary artifacts for NPM publishing and release (assuming a `.npmrc` for NPM auth tokens is configured). Make sure to replace placeholders such as `<github_token>` with appropriate values.

Louis XIV
Louis XIV, sometimes called the Sun King (French: Le Roi Soleil; also "Le Roi de France et Navarre" later) (14 October 1638 – 1 September 1715), was born at the Palace of Versailles in France. He ascended the throne in 1643 aged five after the death of his father Louis XIII during a boy's rule.[1] He was later to become the greatest ruler within the history of European monarchies until the turn of the 20th century where the concept of the sovereign power and individual liberties came to the fore.
During this time, France was the most powerful state in Europe. Louis XIV increased the authority and prestige of the French monarchy by his own efforts, which were later to be followed by France for years to come. Louis XIV's reign is sometimes cited as marking the beginning of the "Century of Despotism", a period where governments ruled with an iron fist and absolute power.
Louis XIV was very important in establishing France as the country of the 'Sun King', one he regarded as the most powerful king in history. Louis XIV sought to rule and control the country without having to negotiate with the different regional nobles, which he accomplished through a centralized absolute monarchy. All regions of France were under his direct rule which he made possible through his ministers, who managed the regions on his orders.
Louis XIV had a very interesting personality. He was known to be stubborn, sometimes to the extreme, at times. He loved to listen to music, dance, and play the courtly games. He was also very competitive with respect to other rulers within Europe. He often took part in games of tug of war, dart tournaments, and other games designed to show his superpowers. Once recorded being seen pushing a wheelbarrow carrying a person named La Fontaine.
Louis XIV's reputation as the 'Sun King'
Louis XIV greatly increased the power of the monarchy in France through centralization. He was nicknamed the Sun King because he believed the Sun was the most powerful star. Being at the center of a universe, he symbolized the same for France. Louis made Paris the center of his kingdom.
This policy was not without its critics. Cardinal Mazarin, Louis XIV's adviser who served as prime minister in Louis XIV's absence, was said to be opposed to the idea. The French nobility had always been strong in their regional territories, but Mazarin had a plan to concentrate them in the capital, Paris. This would give the monarchy a much bigger and stronger grip on the French society. He argued that centralizing everything would be the best tactic to increase the reign and prestige of the French crown.
Louis XIV favored establishing Paris as the only important cultural hub in France and to this effect he ordered the construction of large public projects such as the Hall of Mirrors in the Versailles Palace. The hall was designed to be the center of every aspect of life of the French royal family. Louis XIV also ordered the construction of the Tuileries Palace which became the residence of his wife, Marie Antoinette.
While Louis XIV was concerned with increasing the prestige of the monarchy, he realized that this would make France the envy of all others in Europe. The Sun King policy that made him a global icon became a powerful symbol in Europe. He established several academies where he encouraged European scholars to travel to France and study.
The establishment of academies also increased French knowledge and scholarship. He also gave many prizes for his scholars, many of them notable figures in modern European history. The French culture of the Sun King era was marked by high artistic, architectural, and historical styles.
The Sun King and France
Louis XIV and the Sun King policy also changed the political structure and power hierarchy in France. This enabled him to establish himself not only as the king but also as the central power in all affairs of the kingdom. Louis XIV's political system has influenced the structure of monarchies in modern times.
One of the most notable contributions of Louis XIV's Sun King policy was the creation of absolute monarchy. Through the system of centralized monarchical power, there was only one person at the top, who held all the power. This meant the ruling power was not shared with anyone and also gave the king the right to make decisions without consulting anyone.
Absolute monarchy enabled Louis to centralize all powers into a single individual which made him the most powerful king in history. His Sun King policy also reduced the interference of the nobility in the ruling of France which had always been against his plans.
One of the greatest failures of the Sun King policy was with the War of the Spanish Succession. In his bid to acquire power, Louis XIV decided to install his grandson on the throne of Spain, making his power extend beyond the borders of France. It was a grave miscalculation which resulted in wars between France and allied forces.
The Sun King led France on several wars including the Franco-Spanish War and the Franco-Dutch War. His aim was to increase his power by establishing himself as a great ruler.
Louis XIV as a ruler
Louis XIV was one of the most influential French kings. He strengthened the power of the monarchy by implementing a strict centralized absolute monarchy over France under his rule. He was known for his arrogance and was regarded as the epitome of a great king during his time.
The Sun King, as he was called, was born in the royal palace of Versailles in France on October 14, 1638. His father, Louis XIII, died in 1643, when he was just five years old. He was brought up by his mother, Anne of Austria, and his chief minister, Cardinal Mazarin.
Louis was considered to be an intelligent young boy. He studied under the influence of many philosophers such as Descartes, Hobbes, and Spinoza. His studies would later contribute to him being one of the most influential intellectual figures in Europe.
Louis XIV is best known for his patronage of the arts, sciences, and military. His reign was marked by the expansion of France's military might. Warfare increased significantly under Louis' reign, and the army was under his direct control. Through warfare and building monuments such as the Palace of Versailles, France's prestige increased markedly.

Louis XIV is known to have had an obsession with dancing, often accompanying it with elaborate costumes. The influence of dance was such that he commissioned 117 pieces for the royal ballet. He also created a famous court ballet known as Les Caribes, performed at the Palace of Versailles.

His impact on the arts was not limited to dance. He was an avid patron of music and theater, contributing to their progress during his time.

In terms of architecture, his reign marked a glorious period where grand constructions with symmetrical designs were the order of the day. Many majestic buildings stand today in his honor, including the iconic Palace of Versailles, which showcase his genius.

Cultural Influence of Louis XIV

Louis XIV, known as 'Le Roi Soleil', or 'the Sun King', played a significant role in shaping French culture. His rule marked a prominent era in French literature, arts, theater, and dance.

His reign coincided with a period of increased patronage for artists and scholars, who were invited to create masterpieces in his honor. He encouraged talents like Moliere to entertain, Diderot to explore and philosophers such as Descartes, Spinoza, or Hobbes to provide intellectual substance to his court. This royal engagement led to a significant growth of cultured and intellectual environment, known as 'le Grand Siècle' or 'the Great Century'.

One of his famous patronage was towards dance. Louis XIV personally attended around 150 ballets during his entire reign. He loved performing ballet moves and even composed a ballet on his own called 'Belle au Bois Dormant' (Beautiful Sleep in a Wood). This was a significant achievement considering ballet was still a nascent art form during his time. The French court used theatrical ballet as a form of entertainment and Louis XIV's obsession drove the advancement of this art form.

Adding to the magnificence, Louis XIV commissioned 117 pieces for the Royal Ballet, emphasizing his love for dance and making it a central component of court life. He also introduced a specialized ballet school for training aspiring dancers and choreographers, which further strengthened the institution of ballet.

Theatre is another art form that saw significant growth during Louis' reign. He appreciated and promoted it by commissioning several plays. Some of his favorite playwrights were Moliere and Racine, who were commissioned to write numerous plays.

Theatre performances became so popular during his reign that the Palace of Versailles hosted lavish celebrations marking the successful performances. It became a cultural phenomenon where the King would be seen on stage, contributing to the performers and enthralling his courtiers. Theatres such as the National Theatre and the Pavillon de l'Horloge,

stem from the fact that the ETS is an environmental policy mechanism that is set outside the federal government but has significant environmental impacts that touch into nearly every aspect of how Washington state manages natural resources and regulates business activities.
To address some of these issues, and to better understand the ETS implications for the state, we have commissioned the University of Washington to compile a detailed report (available here).
Through this research, the study has identified key challenges and opportunities facing the state of Washington’s energy and economy. The study also examined potential legislative or regulatory options to address gaps identified in the federal program and to improve the certainty and predictability of the program in the near- and mid-terms for the energy businesses in our state.
The report identifies several issues specific to Washington state. These issues include:
- Washington could experience a credit shortfall
- Washington gas pipelines could be required to switch to ultra-low sulfur natural gas
- Washington could be responsible for buying the carbon allowances
- Washington could experience a substantial increase in energy costs
Despite these concerns, the study found there are a number of positive reasons for moving forward with this legislative or regulatory option:
- A state ETS could increase environmental health and safety protection
- A state ETS would address the lack of regulatory certainty and predictability
- A state ETS could result in less volatility of electricity prices
These are very different reasons for moving forward with a state ETS from the reasons the federal program was originally introduced. However, these reasons clearly provide reasons as to why the state of Washington now has an opportunity to explore a state ETS.
As we continue to explore how the ETS will work in our state and how it will affect Washington businesses, it is important to keep in mind that several other states are considering similar actions.
For more information about the current state of the ETS, the findings of the University of Washington’s ETS report, or to discuss how a state ETS could affect the businesses in your community, please contact your Northwest Energy Institute staff.

MR is a 360-degree, multidisciplinary neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) for high-risk patients from birth until they leave the hospital. The hospital delivers more than 5,000 babies per year.
"We are providing babies and families with the highest-quality care and we need to have quality data to validate those outcomes," says Erin Sullivan, vice president of quality and patient safety at Penn State Health Milton S. Hershey Medical Center.
A unique feature of PHMR is the Patient Experience Registry for Adult Newborns. This longitudinal registries includes a large and diverse population and uses advanced analytics to identify common and unique trends.
"Our data supports what we believe we know clinically in terms of interventions and how we provide care, but now we have data to back up our practices," Sullivan says. There are more than 80 data points within the registry, and new ones are added when necessary, Sullivan adds.
"We can look at things like the number of respiratory complications or antibiotic complications," she says. "A 90-day readmission rate would be included, and what we do as a team is track and evaluate what happened, whether it was our fault, and how we can improve."
Patients at PHMR are at high risk for conditions including extremely low birth weight, respiratory distress syndrome, or other severe medical issues.
“A lot of these parents get to know our team and are relieved to know that the data is there to back us up,” Sullivan says. “We can track and monitor these kids. If we see complications, we can pull the registry and look back at the care, and we’ll be able to identify anything we might have missed.”
In addition, the registry allows the hospital to create population health risk profiles for the community and partner hospitals.
“When you’re doing research and trying to make changes in clinical practice, it’s very difficult to get the right people together for that one data point,” Sullivan says. “With this population, we can get everyone in a room, because there are a lot of different areas this registry pulls in.”
PHMR's population
One feature of the neonatal registry is the fact that many babies being cared for at this hospital have complex multisystem issues that involve cardiac and kidney problems.
“When we care for patients with multiple complex issues, it makes them interesting study subjects for population-based clinical research,” Sullivan says.
In 2016, for example, the hospital used clinical registry data to form a cohort study for patients born weighing less than 1,000 grams. The team involved included a neonatologist, nephrologist, pediatric radiologist, physiologist, and others.
PHMR serves as a teaching hospital for a seven-hospital system run by Pennsylvania State University, providing care to patients with high-risk neonatal conditions. One example of such conditions is babies born extremely preterm.
"We have a very strong interest in looking at these neonates and how they go home and perform both short- and long-term," says Michelle Keenan, chief of neonatal medicine at PHMR.
Keenan says preterm infants born at less than 32 weeks' gestation have a number of medical concerns. "For the most part, we're taking care of kids who have medical problems not related to being preterm," she adds.
A unique feature of the neonatal registry at PHMR is the Patient Experience Registry for Adult Newborns, which includes a diverse population and uses advanced analytics.
One study Keenan conducted used the registry data to follow preterm infants until age 5 for neurodevelopmental outcomes.
“The data we collected at age 9 months was correlated with developmental skills at age 5.”
The study, titled Early Neurological Inflammatory Predictions in Preterm Infants and their Long-Term Outcomes (ENLIPOL TOLO), evaluated neonates who had severe inflammatory mediator responses and received steroids as a treatment.
Although it is unclear exactly how steroids affect infants with the condition, the study concluded that children who went into steroid treatment had significantly better developmental outcomes at age 5 and 9 years.
The study also examined how prenatal steroid treatment affected development in neonates with high fetal inflammatory response mediators, and concluded that those neonates had better development at ages 5 and 9 years of age as well.

nutrition or undernutrition) in young children below the age of two (12 months) and pregnant and lactating women can lead to irreversible effects on their health and their development if not diagnosed and treated early.
Early intervention during acute malnutrition provides the best opportunity to avoid death.
Most children in low and middle income countries survive their first few years of life. This is partly due to dramatic improvements that have occurred in child survival during the past thirty years. However, it is still worrying that despite significant advances in survival of children, the fact that a large number of children die by the age of five is a matter of public health concern.
Most of the deaths in children under five occur in low and middle income countries (especially Africa, Southeast Asia, and Central Asia). These deaths account for approximately one third of the total disease burden in such economies, which in turn costs about US$50 billion annually in lost potential.
More than one third of global deaths of children under five occur in the first 28 days of life and 89 per cent occur in the first year of life. More than half occur during the first six months of life. During the first few weeks after a child's birth, the infant is the main focus of maternal and social attention because of its acute vulnerability to both illness and exposure.
Most deaths that occur just after birth are still related to preventable and treatable causes if timely care is provided. However, this is rarely the case because most maternal and neonatal deaths continue to occur predominantly in settings where skilled attendance at birth and emergency obstetric services are either non-existent or poorly resourced.
Infancy is still the single greatest risk factor for the non-communicable diseases (NCDs), which are causing serious disease and premature mortality worldwide.
Many factors are associated with child mortality. These include maternal illness; infant feeding practices; hygiene practices; environmental and geographical variables; political stability, socioeconomic status, and access to health services. The interplay of these social determinants determines the health status of the child and to a large extent the mortality.
Some social determinants of health are largely beyond the reach of health services, but these factors can be ameliorated through public health interventions. The interplay and interactions between these determinants are highly complex and inevitably challenging to unravel and decipher.
Infancy is a unique phase of life when a vulnerable child can be subjected to any one, or a combination of the following risk factors: exposure to common infectious agents; suboptimal feeding practices; poor maternal behaviour, or care; complications during childbirth; socioeconomic deprivation; and inappropriate use of pharmacological therapies.
Microbiological factors are the critical determinants of child mortality. The most common agents responsible for childhood infectious diseases are bacteria, parasites, and viruses. There is a huge variation in the causative agents and their associated patterns of disease between geographical regions, seasons, and time of life.
The prevalence of several diseases declines to a small level by the age of five but re-emerges later in life because of environmental and biological changes associated with adolescence or adulthood. These include, for example, diarrhoeagenesic bacteria (including bacillus cereus, salmonellae, campylobacter, shigella, and klebsiella), echovirus type 9, hepatitis A virus, rotavirus, rubella virus, and cytomegalovirus.
The leading infectious agents that cause childhood death are HIV, measles, tuberculosis, pneumonia, diarrhoea, malaria, and malnutrition. About one-fourth of all child deaths are attributed to one or more of these infections:
Most infectious diseases occur at low levels in healthy people. However, for one million people who would not normally be considered at risk, the mortality rates could go through the roof because of a change in their environment or immune status.
Many childhood infectious diseases (including bacterial and parasitic diarrhoeas) are preventable by improving sanitation (for example, household water sources), hygiene, and access to good quality, reliable food.

The most significant way to prevent child deaths is to improve health-care services. In many low and middle income countries, health-care facilities are inadequately equipped, poorly staffed, have critical resource short-falls, and generally lack the capacity to offer the required services for effective prevention and management of disease.
The majority of deaths to children under five occur after childbirth and during the first few weeks of life following a child's birth; and most occur within the first 24 hours and first week. To prevent these deaths, the health-care system must be able to provide the following care services:
The most frequently encountered problems in the delivery of child health care are related to inadequate referral systems, poor emergency intervention (especially during childbirth and following delivery), poor integration of perinatal care into maternal care, and unavailability of skilled personnel during birth who would initiate the referral when complications develop—especially for problems that may have been prevented through antepartum care.
With appropriate services (and use of services by the poor and disadvantaged), mortality rates, especially in children under five, could be significantly reduced.
The health outcomes of children can be improved by taking advantage of opportunities to enhance the overall child survival. There is scope in each country (and each community) to reduce child mortality to an even greater extent by focusing on three core measures: (1) preventing new cases of acute childhood illness in those at highest risk; (2) detecting and treating existing acute disease; and (3) sustaining children through their growing up years.
Preventing new cases of acute illness in those at highest risk involves, in addition to the above-mentioned measures of improving the environment, enhancing maternal nutrition at the onset of pregnancy, and improving infants' nutrition in the first few months.
By adopting effective public health measures, most causes of illness that affect children can be prevented, controlled, and even eliminated. These measures involve improving immunization coverage; enhancing safe water provision and sanitation for populations at risk; improving hygiene; and providing information and protection against vector-borne and water-borne infections (including intestinal worms) and neglected diseases.
In children under five, acute illness can be controlled by improving care of those with moderate illness (with simple fever reducing medicines and zinc supplementation); protecting those with serious illnesses in a health-facility by using recommended antibiotic therapy; and improving the referral system so that cases of children in need of care at a higher level of health-facility support can be immediately identified and treated.
In the last few years, there has been substantial progress in improving health-care services for women and their children (i.e. improved antenatal, perinatal, delivery, and postnatal care) and management of young children (i.e. care for acute illness). However, the burden of infectious diseases, particularly HIV, continues to pose a significant challenge to child health.
The most effective way to reduce child mortality (and maternal mortality) is to ensure access to affordable quality health services that are safe and effective and reach the entire population (with free or low-cost services) to prevent illness or to treat it when it occurs.

3. **Materialien**: Das Instrument besteht aus Basso cromatico (einer Art von Bünden, die chromatische Tonarten ermöglichen), Metall und hat auch Kernels aus Holz und Blei, die auf seine akustischen Eigenschaften abgestimmt sind.

Albania, a country situated in the southeastern part of Europe.

Geographical Location

Albania is a landlocked country. To the north is North Macedonia, Kosovo, and the Adriatic Sea. West and south is Montenegro. East is Kosovo. The capital, Tirana, is located in the central southern part of the country. 

Major Mountains

Major mountains of Albania include Korab, Sharr, Pindus and Accursed Mountains. Accursed Mountains, also called Albanian Alps, is the highest part of Albania's geographical landscape. Mount Korab, with its altitude of 2,764 meters, is the tallest peak in the southeastern part of Europe. The Pindus Mountains is a major mountain range in southeastern Europe, extending across Albania, Macedonia, and Greece.

Oceanography

Being a landlocked nation, Albania is not surrounded by any oceanic areas. The closest marine border is the Adriatic Sea which is shared with neighboring countries North Macedonia, Kosovo, and Montenegro. The Adriatic Sea covers a considerable length of Albania's coastline, allowing for a range of marine geological features, such as underwater canyons and abyssal plains.

Seascapes

The most significant sea boundary of Albania provides a rich ecosystem for coastline wildlife, fish, and marine life. Albanian shores are dominated by cliffs, beaches, and rocky shores. Albania's coastline stretches about 363 kilometers and has a low littoral slope. The Adriatic coast of Albania offers natural harbors and inlets known as "ribjës", which are ideal for commercial and recreational sea activities. 

Natural Hazards

Being an earthquake-prone region, Albania frequently experiences geological natural hazards. The tectonic activity along with the country's landlocked position makes it particularly susceptible to landslides, earthquakes, and flash floods.

Due to the country's mountainous terrain, snowy peaks cause disruption to transportation, leading to temporary isolation of some areas. Flash floods, caused by glacial melts and heavy rains, pose significant risks due to their destructive power.

Marine life in the Adriatic Sea and its underwater canyons, though diverse, are greatly threatened by pollution and overfishing, undermining the country's marine ecosystem.

Conclusion

In summary, Albania, a landlocked nation located in southeastern Europe, houses diverse geographical scapes, including the Accursed Mountains, Pindus, and Korab ranges, along with the Adriatic Sea coastline. While the country's natural environment offers remarkable biodiversity, it is continually threatened by both geological and human-induced challenges.

engineer is designing a water fountain that shoots water up to a maximum height of 35 meters. The water takes 3 seconds to reach the maximum height. Assuming the water follows a parabolic trajectory, calculate the total time the water spends in the air before hitting the ground. Also, calculate the initial velocity of the water as it exits the fountain nozzle. To solve this problem, we'll use some physics concepts related to projectile motion under the influence of gravity.

1. First, let's find the total time the water spends in the air.

Since the water takes 3 seconds to reach the maximum height, that's the time it takes for the water to reach the peak of its trajectory. The time to go up is equal to the time to come down for a projectile under gravity without initial horizontal velocity. So the total time in the air will be twice the time taken to reach the maximum height.

Total time in the air = Time to reach max height * 2
Total time in the air = 3 seconds * 2
Total time in the air = 6 seconds

2. Now, let's calculate the initial velocity of the water as it exits the fountain nozzle.

We'll use the kinematic equation for vertical motion under constant acceleration due to gravity (g = 9.81 m/s²):

v = u + at

where:
v = final velocity (0 m/s at the maximum height)
u = initial velocity (which we want to find)
a = acceleration (which is -9.81 m/s² due to gravity acting downwards)
t = time (3 seconds to reach maximum height)

Rearrange the equation to solve for the initial velocity (u):

u = v - at
u = 0 m/s - (-9.81 m/s² * 3 s)
u = 9.81 m/s² * 3 s
u = 29.43 m/s

So, the initial velocity of the water as it exits the fountain nozzle is approximately 29.43 m/s.

In summary:
- The total time the water spends in the air is 6 seconds.
- The initial velocity of the water as it exits the fountain nozzle is approximately 29.43 m/s.

Familiarize Myself with Basics Using an Online Resource
To study the basics of the Afrikaans language, I will use an online educational resource. The resource will cover fundamental vocabulary, basic sentence structures, and essential phrases. This initial step is to gain an understanding of the grammar, pronunciation, and basic communication in Afrikaans. The plan involves:

- Visit an online language learning platform, specifically GeoInterpreter.
- Enroll in the Afrikaans beginner course offered there.
- Following the course structure, daily studies will be carried out to understand the basics.

Step 2: Practise Vocabulary and Basic Phrases Daily
Once I grasp the basics, the next step will be daily practice. This practice will involve reassembling vocabularies learned to form sentences and using the basic phrases more realistically. This could be achieved using flashcards or digital platforms like Duolingo or Memrise.

Step 3: Apply Learning through Afrikaans Media
After a month of basics practice, I will start integrating Afrikaans into my daily activities. For this, I'll subscribe to Afrikaans language podcasts and television programs. This immersion will allow me to see the language being used in context and learn correct pronunciation.

Step 4: Weekly Reflection and Tracking Progress
After each week, I will reflect on my progress and take notes of areas of proficiency and challenges. Sessions with an online tutor can be considered to correct areas of difficulty and answer my doubts.

Step 5: Intermediate Lessons and Complex Structures
Once I'm comfortable with basic phrases, daily sentences, and vocabulary, I'll move to interactive online lessons to tackle more complex sentence structures, idioms, and colloquialisms.

Step 6: Advanced Practice through Conversation Partners
After a few weeks of complex lessons, getting exposure to native speakers will be useful. Platforms like Tandem and HelloTalk can be utilized to communicate with native Afrikaans speakers. This interaction will enhance my fluency and improve pronunciation.

Step 7: Regular Reflection and Improvement
After learning from native speakers, I'll again reflect upon my capabilities and progress, ensuring consistency and improvement. Here again, revising areas of difficulty or asking help from tutors is recommended.

Step 8: Continuous Learning and Practicing
To avoid stagnation, I'll continue with the advanced lessons and immersion through Afrikaans podcasts, TV programs, and social media platforms to keep improving. I'll maintain a consistent practice schedule, dedicating a specific amount of time every day for study and practice.

By following these steps and staying dedicated, I will be able to reach fluency in Afrikaans within two months.

McGreety said: “The number one concern of employers here in Lincolnshire is people – whether it’s retaining and recruiting staff and managing productivity.”
Employers want the government to understand that there are a variety of reasons why businesses put off investment decisions.
“There are reasons why businesses put off large investments,” he said. “It’s not always about the cost of labour.”
Employers have expressed concerns and frustrations about government policies that are seen as hindering recruitment and investment, he continued.
“We have heard from employers, particularly small businesses, who say they are not always aware enough of the opportunities and tools that the government offers to help them help themselves,” Mr Greenstreet said.
“There is a mismatch here. Employers are clearly worried about all aspects of Brexit uncertainty.
“We have heard them ask frequently for clarity in the following areas: how the UK will settle the future of immigration policy, how the country will settle its relationship with the European Union and how new regulations that will spring from this process will impact businesses.”
A number of issues have been raised by employers, including problems with acquiring legal advice or assistance, barriers to access, and the lack of digital and infrastructure development.
DWP data gathered through Lincolnshire Jobs Connect platform has also pointed to concerns about the increase in benefits claims and skills shortages.
The proportion of vacancies in the construction, transport, production and services sector is much higher than the national average, with the highest vacancy rate in logistics (39pc). The lowest vacancy rate is in manufacturing (9pc).
Employers with fewer than 50 staff recorded a lower vacancy rate than national average. Compared with 5 to 49 staff at a business, 100-plus organisations have a one percent greater vacancy rate.
Lincolnshire Jobs Connect is a partnership between employers, unions and the three local jobcentres. The network offers a range of activities including work experience, training, apprenticeships, and other resources to connect local staff and employers.
Employers can search for training vacancies for employees in Lincolnshire using Lincolnshire Jobs Connect. Jobs can be filtered by requirements such as training level, organisation, subject area, age category and number of places available.
Nick Hayes, Labour’s MP for Grantham and Willoughby, said the findings paint a worrying picture of the Lincolnshire job market.
He said: “The data paints a worrying picture for the job market, highlighting how many businesses are struggling to fill their vacancies and are unable to recruit new employees.
“The report also shows that a lack of skills training is damaging our region’s prosperity and we need to focus on the issue now to build up a pipeline of skilled recruits in the coming years.
“There’s a concern that employers are put off from hiring and investing due to the general Brexit uncertainty – and there’s a feeling that the UK government is not providing enough clarity on how Brexit will affect businesses.
“With so much uncertainty and confusion, the country’s long-term productivity and prosperity looks questionable. We must see a joined-up effort from all the stakeholders – employers, local MPs and the government – to solve the local skills issues and fill those training and recruitment gaps as a matter of urgency.”

Hintergrund der Geschichte: In Anlehnung an die Beziehung im Spiel Die Wütenden unter den Stachelbeeren, hier geht es um die Beziehung zwischen dem Zorro und seinem Verräter, Don Diego de la Vega (oder Don Diego von Aragon), den er als seine Gefährten bezeichnet. Die beiden leben entflohen auf einem abgelegenen Hügel im Dschungel, um zu entkommen. Sie werden von dem schurkischen Kommandanten der Spanier, Don Gaspar, verfolgt, der versucht, sie zu überrumpeln, und sie werden gejagt.

Text: Der Tag wurde langsam rot und Don Diego wusste, es war Zeit sich aufzurichten. Sie hatten bereits frühmorgens den Dschungel durchstreift, aber die Verfolger waren immer nah, ihre Schatten schienen auf sie heraufzutraten in einem zähflüssigen Galopp - Don Gaspar und sein Gefolge von mutigen Söldnern.

Optionen:
- A: Don Diego wachte auf, fühlte sich trotz seiner hitzigen Befreiungsaktion träge und erschöpft. Der Dschungel sprach nicht von Anarchie, und immer noch war er aufzuwachen, die Verfolgung zu beseitigen und die Kämpfe zu gewinnen.
- B: Don Gaspar beobachtete die flüchtenden Figuren aus der Ferne und hielt ruhig und kalt seine Muskeln in bereitschaft. Er war in der Luft fixiert und bereit, sich dem Verlieren von Don Diego und seinem unerkannten Geliebten zu widmen, wenn er den richtigen Moment beobachte.
- C: Es fing an zu regnen, mit dem Dschungel, der umhüllt wurde, der sich mit sanfteren Schritten drehte. Die beiden Entflohenen, Don Diego und der gebeizte Zorro verliebten sich dabei in den schäbigen Charme des Regens.
- D: Inmitten des stürmischen Rumpelns der Wildnis wurde eine sanfte Ermüdung in Don Dianos Herz empfindbar. Obwohl seine Herzschläge noch ungebändigt waren, wussten er und der Zorro, dass ihr Geist und ihre Kräfte stummer Beweise ihres verzweifelten Einsatzes waren.

Basierend auf dem Hintergrund könnte die Option am besten als nächstes sein:

B: Don Gaspar beobachtete die flüchtigen Figuren aus der Ferne und hielt ruhig und kalt seine Muskeln in bereitschaft. Er war in der Luft fixiert und bereit, sich dem Verlieren von Don Diego und seinem unerkannten Geliebten zu widmen, wenn er den richtigen Moment beobachte.

Erklärung: Diese Option passt zur Situation, weil sie sich auf die Verfolgung und das Gefangenemamen Don Diego und seiner Anführer konzentriert, was mit dem von dem Narrativ bereitgestellten Hintergrund übereinstimmt. Die Situation widerspiegelt die Spannung und das Potenzial des Kampfes, ein Hauptthema in der Geschichte. Andere Optionen, wie A und D, drehen sich mehr um die Perspektive von Don Diego, und C ist irrelevant, weil sie eine romantische Note einbringt, die nichts mit der Erzählung zu tun hat. Daher kann B die Geschichte am besten fortsetzen.

Ignore the following conditions when you test for equality between floating point numbers.


* Difference smaller than some tolerance: a=abs(a-b) <= tolerance
* If a negative, they aren't equal even if the absolute difference is smaller:


* abs(a) < tolerance and a < 0


* If a equal to zero, then zero is smaller than any tolerance.



Here is a modified function which includes all of the above conditions:

```python
def nearly_equal(a, b, tolerance=1e-10):
    # Tolerance to check if two numbers are roughly equal
    # considering the limitations of floating point precision

    if a == b:
        return True

    diff = abs(a - b)

    # Check if the difference is within the tolerance
    if diff <= tolerance:
        return True

    # Check if a is negative and the absolute difference is within tolerance
    if a < 0 and diff <= tolerance:
        return True

    # Check if a is zero and the absolute difference is within a large tolerance range
    if a == 0 and diff < 1e-20:
        return True

    return False
```

You can use this function to compare floating point numbers with the following syntax:

```python
a = 1.23456789
b = 1.2345678

if nearly_equal(a, b):
    print("The numbers are nearly equal within the tolerance")
else:
    print("The numbers are not nearly equal")
```

In this example, the function will return `True` because the absolute difference between `a` and `b` (9e-8) is smaller than the tolerance of `1e-10`, even though `a` and `b` are not exactly equal.

Please note that, the `tolerance` parameter can be adjusted depending on the level of precision you need. A smaller value will make the function more strict whereas a larger value will allow more "rounding error".

Also, it's essential to consider that these rules might not cover all the edge cases concerning floating point comparison, which can get complex and sometimes requires more advanced techniques, especially when dealing with very high precision computations or very small numbers.

Hope this helped! Don't hesitate to reach out if you have more questions about this topic.

kunnen sinds de jaren negentig (ongeveer 60,000 inmiddels) op een rij. Het waren oorspronkelijk allemaal Amerikaanse hervermenen met een vleugelpunt met stofbehoudszakjes, maar de afstammelingen van deze vliegtuigen hebben geophysieke en geologische begeleiding uitgevoerd om bij te dragen aan het onderzoek naar het ontbreken ter plaatse van fossielen die door mijnratten op Antarctica zouden suggereren.
Afleveringen
Het begin van de Antarctische ondervloerdiscoveryfilm begon in januari 2004 en voltooide zich in 2009 toen 60 vliegtuigen zijn gevorderd bij de onderzoeksmission, waarbij vijf zijn verloren gegaan door verschillende fouten die plaatsvonden bij de zinkbeurt die werd gebruikt om de vlieugeniers te begeleiden voor hun werk.
De antarktische olievlekfilm werd geproduceerd door de Britse Ridley Scotia, die de uitvoering van een 3,500 dollar ontwikkelingsmijnafwastuig en het bepalen van de voltooide film leverde aan een crew van tien lid-gewerkte specialisten, die hun werk verdeelden over drie filmsets ver van de onderzeeërvloten.
Samenwerking
De film is gemaakt door het bedrijf RidleyScotia Technologies, waarvoor John Ridley, Scott McMorrow en Shankar Sastry in Westminster, London, zijn werkzaam zijn. Er traden tien werknemers uit verschillende disciplines op en drie van hen hadden van tevoren met de aangewezen Antarctic Scientific Drilling Association samengewerkt.
Het is de eerste keer dat de Drilling Associatie een filmteam heeft ondersteund om de ontwikkeling van de film op het spel te krijgen, en door deze samenwerking was de film een aanwinst voor het Internationale Antarktis Commissie (IAC) dat bijdraagt aan de bescherming van het Antarktische continent voor de wetenschappelijke studie.
Filmresultaten
De film toont de volledige wetenschappelijke opsplitsing en de aanzienlijke co-ordinatie die nodig is voor de voortgang van een project zoals dit, zodat het een leermiddel is voor het publiek voor het begrijpen en waarderen van het belang van wetenschappelijke vooruitgang die wordt gegeven aan landschappen zoals Antarctica.
De film is uitverijdend gemaakt om het IAC-bureau, het Wetenschappelijke Kwartier, universiteiten en andere onderzoeksinstituten te dienen nadat het is gepubliceerd op DVD. Tijdens de open herbezoeken van het IAC begrijpen geïnteresseerden de filmpjonger toegang te krijgen en bezoeken de filmenserie.
Uitverijdingen
- IAC (Bureau voor Bevordering van het Wetenschappelijke Commissie)
- Wetenschappelijke Departementen van universiteiten
- Voormalige academische instituten
- Secties en afdelingen van de vakgroep
Advertentie
- Prijzen van de DVD:
- Prijzen per set (5 nummers op 2 disk): $62.50
Het gaat over de Antartische olievlek
Fakta
De ontdekking van de Antarctic Oil Lakes is een historische gebeurtenis in het wetenschappelijke onderzoek van de oceaan en de bodem van de wereld. De ontdekking heeft een veelgroter wetenschappelijk begin gegeven voor Antarctica en op het moment van zijn eerste aansluiting heeft het wereldbekende wetenschappelijke onderzoeksteam en het Internationale Commissie bewegingen teweeggebracht die het onderzoek naar het onderliggende geloof van het continent hebben gerijpt.
Antarctica in het onderwijs
De Antartische Olievlekfilm was daarom speciaal ontworpen om antarctisch onderwijs te stimuleren met zijn unieke informatie en educatieve kernen, waarbij het volledige internationale Antarctic Scientific Drilling Association programma als de inspirator voor het onderwijs wordt benadrukt dat door verkennings- en andere filmmakers wordt getoond ter illustratie. Deze film is bedoeld om de wereldwijde hof te boeien door het antarktische onderzoek te illustreren, en haar inzichtelijke schatten en geavanceerde methoden kunnen verbreden voor wereldwijde studenten, van welke onderwijsniveau het is.
De Antarktische Olievlekfilm is een bijzonder geniale leertuin voor leerlingen, zodat ze enkele belangrijke informatie kunnen doorgronden en daardoor het beperkte antarktische beperkte terrein aanvullen door een volledig onderzoeksgerichte filmafgifte. Op basis van de ontdekkingsthema’s is de film een verrijkende bronnenmiddel voor de wetenschappelijke en geografische lessen die in het antarktische onderwijssysteem worden verwezen in de volgende onderwerpen:
- De afwezigheid van fossielen in het Antarktisgebied.
- Haar geologisch verleden en oordeelingsmethode.
- De methode voor het vinden van geplande olievensters en vlakke gebieden op de Antarctic oceaan.
- Verdenking van het oppervlaktewaterspilling van het continent.
- Het verschil tussen het ontwerpplan om voor te bereiden op de reis naar de pool van antarctische olie en hun geografische bevindingen.
Naast deze thematische lessen, ziet de fysieke wereld van de Antarktische Olievlekfilm het antarctische ontdekkingsgordijn vervlechten waarbij ze gebruik maken van kunstmatige ingenieurelementen voor beeldgevingsstijl om de oppervlakte van het antarktische oceaanlandschap en de technische methoden die worden gebruikt tijdens antarktisch oppervlakteonderzoek te vermaken.
De Antarktische Olievlekfilm is bijzonder geschikt om te gebruiken door geologische wetenschappers, naai-technici, geologie en oceanografie onderwijsadministraties in de klaslokalen, om het antarctische onderzoek naar oppervlakte en oceanische gevallen te tonen. De film voegt kracht in het antarktische onderwijsprogramma toe door zichtbaar te maken, rekening houdend met het innovatieve onderzoek en de geavanceerde technieken die worden gebruikt tijdens antarktische lezingen, wat leerlingen aanmoedigt om geïnteresseerd te raken in de technische aspecten van onderzoek en de complexe antarctische leerinhoud aan te wijzen.
Het antarktische ontdekkingsplan
De Antarctic Olievlekfilm is gebaseerd op een reëel antarktisch onderzoeksproject, namelijk de Antarctic Olievensters Programma, dat door de Internationale Antarktis Commissie (IAC) en de South Atlantic Ocean Commission werd ontworpen en voltooid. De antarktisch olievensteronderzoek werd uitgezet in 2003 en het olievensteronderzoek werd uitgevoerd van 2004 tot 2009 op de Dome F-olievensters, waar meer dan 500 meter van de oppervlakte van de antarktische oceaan en de oevers van antarktische oppervlakte kan worden doorzocht voor fossiele vondsten.
Onderzoeksopzet
De Antarctic Olievenster Onderzoeksopstelling verbleef op meer dan 3 jaar in het Dome (350 km van Polegeburen of 418 mijl) en 90 km van De Beltkroon. De IAC drong bij het Bureau voor Bevordering van het Wetenschappelijke Bureau van het Antarktische Commissie (IAC) aan om de voltooiing van het Antarctic Olievensteronderzoekproces te bieden met behulp van de ontwerpplanningsmethode, waarbij ongeveer 40 scientisten wer

développement de l'Autorité palestinienne et du processus politique, la présidence de la BAD a pris les mesures suivantes:
* En 2016, elle a reçu un programme d'aide d'un montant de 25 millions de dollars. Ce programme, qui soutient le développement des capacités administratives dans l'Autorité palestinienne, fait partie de la vision palestinienne de la démocratie représentative et durable.

Dans ce cadre, la Banque a accordé un soutien au gouvernement palestinien dans de nombreux domaines, y compris la décentralisation administrative, la réforme des institutions de base et des services publics, la protection et l'entrelacement des réserves fiscales, la santé, la recherche scientifique, les droits des femmes et celui du peuple palestinien.

* En août 2014, le Groupe de travail de l'Autorité palestinienne à la BAD a été créé, en vue de renforcer la collaboration des acteurs institutionnels palestiniens et internationaux chargés de la promotion et de la défense des intérêts palestiniens.

* Le Groupe de travail joue un rôle pivot dans la promotion du développement du Programme d'action et d'objectifs pour l'Autorité palestinienne et sa mise en œuvre. Ce programme contribue à la consolidation du système administratif palestinien, et notamment à établir des systèmes robustes de finances publiques internes et de gestion financière, qui permettent de rendre plus efficaces les services publics de l'Autorité palestinienne, tout en fournissant à l'avenir une base pour leur opération économique indépendante.

* À travers sa vision, la BAD continue de soutenir le processus politique arabe et palestinien et s'efforce de renforcer le dialogue de paix dans la région, ce qui constitue un élément central de la vision des Nations Unies concernant l'après-guerre israélo-arabe.

* À l'approche des élections législatives, le Groupe de travail travaille de concert avec d'autres forces actives à ces élections afin de garantir l'éclaircissement des prérogatives des bureaucrates et du personnel administratif.

* De même, à l'approche des élections municipales, le Groupe de travail soutient activement les instances locales pour préparer leur participation à cette étape cruciale vers la consolidation des institutions représentatives palestiniennes.

* Dans ce contexte, la Banque est prête à poursuivre son soutien intégral à l'Autorité palestinienne dans la période cruciale d'organisation de la région, ainsi que dans l'établissement de ses institutions de base, en vue d'éclairer le processus démocratique et de renforcer les structures institutions de base dans le secteur administratif, dans l'intérêt de renforcer la paix et de créer une base pour un développement durable au bénéfice des citoyens des Territoires palestiniens.

La situation en Syrie

En dépit de la situation en cours dans la Syrie, le Groupe de travail de la BAD sur la Syrie restera engagé dans la mise en œuvre de décisions du Conseil, notamment celle relative à l'octroi d'une assistance complémentaire de 55,3 millions de dollars, répartie à travers les cinq projets du programme, pour l'année 2017 (voir ci-dessous).

En effet, le fait que la BAD soit constamment présente en Syrie témoigne du lien solide entre la BAD et sa mission, et de sa détermination à poursuivre son soutien en cette période troublée.

L'engagement de la BAD continue de soutenir les besoins des personnes vulnérables en Syrie. Le travail de la BAD auprès des enfants, des femmes et des personnes handicapées a atteint un niveau mondial de qualité, tandis qu'elle persévère dans l'application de méthodes innovantes et réfléchies pour un développement économique durable.

L'engagement de la BAD se fonde sur son travail au sein du Groupe de travail:

* Continuer d'examiner et de renforcer les programmes sectoriels du Groupe de travail syrien, dans l'intérêt du rétablissement et de la reconstruction de la nation syrienne.

* Continuer d'apporter soutien et expertise technique à la BAD, tant à l'intérieur que au-delà des frontières du pays, afin d'appuyer les efforts de relance, notamment en matière de formation, d'emploi et de réhabilitation de l'infrastructure, compte tenu de l'urgence qui frappe les populations syriennes les plus vulnérables.

* Continuer de promouvoir l'effort international de relance de l'économie et de création d'emplois, ainsi que la participation active au processus politique syrien, au moyen d'initiatives et de programmes innovants soutenus par la communauté internationale.

* Continuer à soutenir les efforts diplomatiques et la médiation humanitaire dans le contexte des négociations inter-syriennes.

Programmes sur cinq projets

| 1. L'éducation des jeunes en Syrie | |

Le programme couvre les écoles primaires, secondaires et supérieures, ainsi que les réfugiés syriens en Jordanie et au Liban, pour un effectif de 1 250 000 élèves, et sert de soutien au retour de la Syrie. Ce programme contribue également à encourager le développement économique et social à long terme à travers les partenariats.

| 2. Renforcement des capacités des femmes syriennes | |

Ce projet soutient les initiatives entrepreneuriales des femmes, et contribue à l'application des méthodologies innovantes du secteur et à l'apprentissage de l'emploi. En outre, il accorde des subventions aux associations nationales réformateurs dirigées par des femmes, et à des groupes informels qui leur servent de porte d'entrée au processus politique national, en contribuant au renforcement des capacités de ces femmes et en leur permettant d'agir en tant que leaders au sein des écosystèmes de développement économique et de bonne gouvernance.

| 3. Programme d'actions pour renforcer les capacités administratives des municipalités de la réconciliation | |

Ce projet vise à réhabiliter les zones administratives municipales touchées par la guerre, de manière à créer des conditions optimales pour le rétablissement, qui sont aussi solides pour les situations d'après-conflit. Ce programme vise à renforcer l'autonomie locale notamment par le développement d'initiatives durables pour les femmes et les jeunes, mais aussi de partenariats avec les organisations locales.

| 4. Programme d'entretien et de restauration des édifices publics et des infrastructures | |

Ce programme soutient les communes et bénéficie directement à 17 000 populations locales en vue de la création d'infrastructures publiques, telles que des écoles, des hôpitaux, des équipements sportifs, des centres de santé et des centres de coordination communautaire, par plus de 32 000 associations et un système de réseau de gouvernance inclusif.

| 5. Renforcement de la stabilité des fondements financiers, les réserves fiscales, et l'industrialisation | |

Ce projet consolide et renforce l'autonomie de l'Autorité centrale compétente en matière fiscale, afin de créer des conditions favorables pour relever les défis économiques auxquels est confrontée la nation syrienne, et accorder des opportunités à l'Autorité de s'engager dans des activités industrielles et non-industrielles.

Approche et engagement

L'approche de la BAD consiste à :

* Écouter et faire le nécessaire pour favoriser le travail par une équipe globale de spécialiste sur le terrain dans le sens de la réhabilitation et de la reconstruction des infrastructures.

* Soutenir, dans un environnement favorable et confiant, les acteurs économiques et les institutions au sein des régions concernées, et ainsi contribuer à créer un environnement propice pour le développement économ
